<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="PodSecurityContext" data-link-title="PodSecurityContext">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14038">
        interface <strong>PodSecurityContext</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>interface</span> <span class='nx'>PodSecurityContext</span></code></pre>

PodSecurityContext holds pod-level security attributes and common container settings. Some
fields are also present in container.securityContext.  Field values of
container.securityContext take precedence over field values of PodSecurityContext.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSecurityContext-fsGroup">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14048">property <b>fsGroup</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>fsGroup?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

A special supplemental group that applies to all containers in a pod. Some volume types
allow the Kubelet to change the ownership of that volume to be owned by the pod:

1. The owning GID will be the FSGroup 2. The setgid bit is set (new files created in the
volume will be owned by FSGroup) 3. The permission bits are OR'd with rw-rw----

If unset, the Kubelet will not modify the ownership and permissions of any volume.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSecurityContext-fsGroupChangePolicy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14057">property <b>fsGroupChangePolicy</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>fsGroupChangePolicy?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

fsGroupChangePolicy defines behavior of changing ownership and permission of the volume
before being exposed inside Pod. This field will only apply to volume types which support
fsGroup based ownership(and permissions). It will have no effect on ephemeral volume types
such as: secret, configmaps and emptydir. Valid values are "OnRootMismatch" and "Always".
If not specified defaults to "Always".

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSecurityContext-runAsGroup">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14064">property <b>runAsGroup</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>runAsGroup?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The GID to run the entrypoint of the container process. Uses runtime default if unset. May
also be set in SecurityContext.  If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the
value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence for that container.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSecurityContext-runAsNonRoot">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14073">property <b>runAsNonRoot</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>runAsNonRoot?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Indicates that the container must run as a non-root user. If true, the Kubelet will
validate the image at runtime to ensure that it does not run as UID 0 (root) and fail to
start the container if it does. If unset or false, no such validation will be performed.
May also be set in SecurityContext.  If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext,
the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSecurityContext-runAsUser">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14081">property <b>runAsUser</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>runAsUser?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The UID to run the entrypoint of the container process. Defaults to user specified in image
metadata if unspecified. May also be set in SecurityContext.  If set in both
SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes
precedence for that container.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSecurityContext-seLinuxOptions">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14089">property <b>seLinuxOptions</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>seLinuxOptions?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='#SELinuxOptions'>SELinuxOptions</a>&gt;;</code></pre>

The SELinux context to be applied to all containers. If unspecified, the container runtime
will allocate a random SELinux context for each container.  May also be set in
SecurityContext.  If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value
specified in SecurityContext takes precedence for that container.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSecurityContext-supplementalGroups">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14095">property <b>supplementalGroups</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>supplementalGroups?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

A list of groups applied to the first process run in each container, in addition to the
container's primary GID.  If unspecified, no groups will be added to any container.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSecurityContext-sysctls">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14101">property <b>sysctls</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>sysctls?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='#Sysctl'>Sysctl</a>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

Sysctls hold a list of namespaced sysctls used for the pod. Pods with unsupported sysctls
(by the container runtime) might fail to launch.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSecurityContext-windowsOptions">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14108">property <b>windowsOptions</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>windowsOptions?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='#WindowsSecurityContextOptions'>WindowsSecurityContextOptions</a>&gt;;</code></pre>

The Windows specific settings applied to all containers. If unspecified, the options within
a container's SecurityContext will be used. If set in both SecurityContext and
PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence.

<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14128">property <b>activeDeadlineSeconds</b></a>

If specified, the pod's scheduling constraints

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSpec-automountServiceAccountToken">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14139">property <b>automountServiceAccountToken</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>automountServiceAccountToken?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

AutomountServiceAccountToken indicates whether a service account token should be

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSpec-containers">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14121">property <b>containers</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>containers: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='#Container'>Container</a>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

List of containers belonging to the pod. Containers cannot currently be added or removed.
There must be at least one container in a Pod. Cannot be updated.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSpec-dnsConfig">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14145">property <b>dnsConfig</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>dnsConfig?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='#PodDNSConfig'>PodDNSConfig</a>&gt;;</code></pre>

Specifies the DNS parameters of a pod. Parameters specified here will be merged to the
generated DNS configuration based on DNSPolicy.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSpec-dnsPolicy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14154">property <b>dnsPolicy</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>dnsPolicy?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Set DNS policy for the pod. Defaults to "ClusterFirst". Valid values are
'ClusterFirstWithHostNet', 'ClusterFirst', 'Default' or 'None'. DNS parameters given in
DNSConfig will be merged with the policy selected with DNSPolicy. To have DNS options set
along with hostNetwork, you have to specify DNS policy explicitly to
'ClusterFirstWithHostNet'.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSpec-enableServiceLinks">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14161">property <b>enableServiceLinks</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>enableServiceLinks?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

EnableServiceLinks indicates whether information about services should be injected into
pod's environment variables, matching the syntax of Docker links. Optional: Defaults to
true.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSpec-ephemeralContainers">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14171">property <b>ephemeralContainers</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>ephemeralContainers?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='#EphemeralContainer'>EphemeralContainer</a>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

List of ephemeral containers run in this pod. Ephemeral containers may be run in an
existing pod to perform user-initiated actions such as debugging. This list cannot be
specified when creating a pod, and it cannot be modified by updating the pod spec. In order
to add an ephemeral container to an existing pod, use the pod's ephemeralcontainers
subresource. This field is alpha-level and is only honored by servers that enable the
EphemeralContainers feature.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSpec-hostAliases">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14177">property <b>hostAliases</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>hostAliases?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='#HostAlias'>HostAlias</a>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

HostAliases is an optional list of hosts and IPs that will be injected into the pod's hosts
file if specified. This is only valid for non-hostNetwork pods.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSpec-hostIPC">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14182">property <b>hostIPC</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>hostIPC?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Use the host's ipc namespace. Optional: Default to false.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSpec-hostNetwork">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14188">property <b>hostNetwork</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>hostNetwork?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Host networking requested for this pod. Use the host's network namespace. If this option is
set, the ports that will be used must be specified. Default to false.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSpec-hostPID">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14193">property <b>hostPID</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>hostPID?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Use the host's pid namespace. Optional: Default to false.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSpec-hostname">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14199">property <b>hostname</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>hostname?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Specifies the hostname of the Pod If not specified, the pod's hostname will be set to a
system-defined value.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSpec-imagePullSecrets">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14208">property <b>imagePullSecrets</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>imagePullSecrets?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='#LocalObjectReference'>LocalObjectReference</a>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

ImagePullSecrets is an optional list of references to secrets in the same namespace to use
for pulling any of the images used by this PodSpec. If specified, these secrets will be
passed to individual puller implementations for them to use. For example, in the case of
docker, only DockerConfig type secrets are honored. More info:
https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images#specifying-imagepullsecrets-on-a-pod

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSpec-initContainers">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14222">property <b>initContainers</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>initContainers?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='#Container'>Container</a>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

List of initialization containers belonging to the pod. Init containers are executed in
order prior to containers being started. If any init container fails, the pod is considered
to have failed and is handled according to its restartPolicy. The name for an init
container or normal container must be unique among all containers. Init containers may not
have Lifecycle actions, Readiness probes, Liveness probes, or Startup probes. The
resourceRequirements of an init container are taken into account during scheduling by
finding the highest request/limit for each resource type, and then using the max of of that
value or the sum of the normal containers. Limits are applied to init containers in a
similar fashion. Init containers cannot currently be added or removed. Cannot be updated.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/init-containers/

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSpec-nodeName">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14229">property <b>nodeName</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>nodeName?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

NodeName is a request to schedule this pod onto a specific node. If it is non-empty, the
scheduler simply schedules this pod onto that node, assuming that it fits resource
requirements.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSpec-nodeSelector">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14236">property <b>nodeSelector</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>nodeSelector?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;{[key: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>]: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;}&gt;;</code></pre>

NodeSelector is a selector which must be true for the pod to fit on a node. Selector which
must match a node's labels for the pod to be scheduled on that node. More info:
https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/assign-pod-node/

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSpec-overhead">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14250">property <b>overhead</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>overhead?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object'>object</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Overhead represents the resource overhead associated with running a pod for a given
RuntimeClass. This field will be autopopulated at admission time by the RuntimeClass
admission controller. If the RuntimeClass admission controller is enabled, overhead must
not be set in Pod create requests. The RuntimeClass admission controller will reject Pod
create requests which have the overhead already set. If RuntimeClass is configured and
selected in the PodSpec, Overhead will be set to the value defined in the corresponding
RuntimeClass, otherwise it will remain unset and treated as zero. More info:
https://git.k8s.io/enhancements/keps/sig-node/20190226-pod-overhead.md This field is
alpha-level as of Kubernetes v1.16, and is only honored by servers that enable the
PodOverhead feature.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSpec-preemptionPolicy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14257">property <b>preemptionPolicy</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>preemptionPolicy?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

PreemptionPolicy is the Policy for preempting pods with lower priority. One of Never,
PreemptLowerPriority. Defaults to PreemptLowerPriority if unset. This field is alpha-level
and is only honored by servers that enable the NonPreemptingPriority feature.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSpec-priority">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14265">property <b>priority</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>priority?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The priority value. Various system components use this field to find the priority of the
pod. When Priority Admission Controller is enabled, it prevents users from setting this
field. The admission controller populates this field from PriorityClassName. The higher the
value, the higher the priority.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSpec-priorityClassName">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14274">property <b>priorityClassName</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>priorityClassName?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

If specified, indicates the pod's priority. "system-node-critical" and
"system-cluster-critical" are two special keywords which indicate the highest priorities
with the former being the highest priority. Any other name must be defined by creating a
PriorityClass object with that name. If not specified, the pod priority will be default or
zero if there is no default.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSpec-readinessGates">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14282">property <b>readinessGates</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>readinessGates?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='#PodReadinessGate'>PodReadinessGate</a>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

If specified, all readiness gates will be evaluated for pod readiness. A pod is ready when
all its containers are ready AND all conditions specified in the readiness gates have
status equal to "True" More info:
https://git.k8s.io/enhancements/keps/sig-network/0007-pod-ready%2B%2B.md

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSpec-restartPolicy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14289">property <b>restartPolicy</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>restartPolicy?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Restart policy for all containers within the pod. One of Always, OnFailure, Never. Default
to Always. More info:
https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle/#restart-policy

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSpec-runtimeClassName">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14299">property <b>runtimeClassName</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>runtimeClassName?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

RuntimeClassName refers to a RuntimeClass object in the node.k8s.io group, which should be
used to run this pod.  If no RuntimeClass resource matches the named class, the pod will
not be run. If unset or empty, the "legacy" RuntimeClass will be used, which is an implicit
class with an empty definition that uses the default runtime handler. More info:
https://git.k8s.io/enhancements/keps/sig-node/runtime-class.md This is a beta feature as of
Kubernetes v1.14.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSpec-schedulerName">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14305">property <b>schedulerName</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>schedulerName?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

If specified, the pod will be dispatched by specified scheduler. If not specified, the pod
will be dispatched by default scheduler.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSpec-securityContext">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14311">property <b>securityContext</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>securityContext?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='#PodSecurityContext'>PodSecurityContext</a>&gt;;</code></pre>

SecurityContext holds pod-level security attributes and common container settings.
Optional: Defaults to empty.  See type description for default values of each field.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSpec-serviceAccount">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14317">property <b>serviceAccount</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>serviceAccount?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

DeprecatedServiceAccount is a depreciated alias for ServiceAccountName. Deprecated: Use
serviceAccountName instead.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSpec-serviceAccountName">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14323">property <b>serviceAccountName</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>serviceAccountName?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

ServiceAccountName is the name of the ServiceAccount to use to run this pod. More info:
https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/configure-service-account/

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSpec-shareProcessNamespace">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14331">property <b>shareProcessNamespace</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>shareProcessNamespace?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Share a single process namespace between all of the containers in a pod. When this is set
containers will be able to view and signal processes from other containers in the same pod,
and the first process in each container will not be assigned PID 1. HostPID and
ShareProcessNamespace cannot both be set. Optional: Default to false.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSpec-subdomain">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14338">property <b>subdomain</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>subdomain?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

If specified, the fully qualified Pod hostname will be "&lt;hostname&gt;.&lt;subdomain&gt;.&lt;pod
namespace&gt;.svc.&lt;cluster domain&gt;". If not specified, the pod will not have a domainname at
all.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSpec-terminationGracePeriodSeconds">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14349">property <b>terminationGracePeriodSeconds</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>terminationGracePeriodSeconds?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Optional duration in seconds the pod needs to terminate gracefully. May be decreased in
delete request. Value must be non-negative integer. The value zero indicates delete
immediately. If this value is nil, the default grace period will be used instead. The grace
period is the duration in seconds after the processes running in the pod are sent a
termination signal and the time when the processes are forcibly halted with a kill signal.
Set this value longer than the expected cleanup time for your process. Defaults to 30
seconds.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSpec-tolerations">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14354">property <b>tolerations</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>tolerations?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='#Toleration'>Toleration</a>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

If specified, the pod's tolerations.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSpec-topologySpreadConstraints">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14362">property <b>topologySpreadConstraints</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>topologySpreadConstraints?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='#TopologySpreadConstraint'>TopologySpreadConstraint</a>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

TopologySpreadConstraints describes how a group of pods ought to spread across topology
domains. Scheduler will schedule pods in a way which abides by the constraints. This field
is only honored by clusters that enable the EvenPodsSpread feature. All
topologySpreadConstraints are ANDed.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodSpec-volumes">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14368">property <b>volumes</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>volumes?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='#Volume'>Volume</a>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

List of volumes that can be mounted by containers belonging to the pod. More info:
https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="PodStatus" data-link-title="PodStatus">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14377">

    </a>
</h3>

PodStatus represents information about the status of a pod. Status may trail the actual state
of a system, especially if the node that hosts the pod cannot contact the control plane.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodStatus-conditions">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14382">property <b>conditions</b></a>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>conditions?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='#PodCondition'>PodCondition</a>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

Current service state of pod. More info:
https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#pod-conditions

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodStatus-containerStatuses">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14389">property <b>containerStatuses</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>containerStatuses?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='#ContainerStatus'>ContainerStatus</a>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

The list has one entry per container in the manifest. Each entry is currently the output of
`docker inspect`. More info:
https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#pod-and-container-status

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodStatus-ephemeralContainerStatuses">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14395">property <b>ephemeralContainerStatuses</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>ephemeralContainerStatuses?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='#ContainerStatus'>ContainerStatus</a>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

Status for any ephemeral containers that have run in this pod. This field is alpha-level
and is only populated by servers that enable the EphemeralContainers feature.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodStatus-hostIP">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14400">property <b>hostIP</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>hostIP?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

IP address of the host to which the pod is assigned. Empty if not yet scheduled.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodStatus-initContainerStatuses">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14408">property <b>initContainerStatuses</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>initContainerStatuses?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='#ContainerStatus'>ContainerStatus</a>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

The list has one entry per init container in the manifest. The most recent successful init
container will have ready = true, the most recently started container will have startTime
set. More info:
https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#pod-and-container-status

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodStatus-message">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14413">property <b>message</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>message?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

A human readable message indicating details about why the pod is in this condition.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodStatus-nominatedNodeName">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14424">property <b>nominatedNodeName</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>nominatedNodeName?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

nominatedNodeName is set only when this pod preempts other pods on the node, but it cannot
be scheduled right away as preemption victims receive their graceful termination periods.
This field does not guarantee that the pod will be scheduled on this node. Scheduler may
decide to place the pod elsewhere if other nodes become available sooner. Scheduler may
also decide to give the resources on this node to a higher priority pod that is created
after preemption. As a result, this field may be different than PodSpec.nodeName when the
pod is scheduled.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PodStatus-phase">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L14444">property <b>phase</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>phase?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The phase of a Pod is a simple, high-level summary of where the Pod is in its lifecycle.
The conditions array, the reason and message fields, and the individual container status
arrays contain more detail about the pod's status. There are five possible phase values:

Pending: The pod has been accepted by the Kubernetes system, but one or more of the
container images has not been created. This includes time before being scheduled as well as
time spent downloading images over the network, which could take a while. Running: The pod
has been bound to a node, and all of the containers have been created. At least one
container is still running, or is in the process of starting or restarting. Succeeded: All
containers in the pod have terminated in success, and will not be restarted. Failed: All
containers in the pod have terminated, and at least one container has terminated in
failure. The container either exited with non-zero status or was terminated by the system.
Unknown: For some reason the state of the pod could not be obtained, typically due to an
error in communicating with the host of the pod.

More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#pod-phase

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="Secret-data">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L15411">property <b>data</b></a>

or '.'. The serialized form of the secret data is a base64 encoded string, representing the

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="Secret-immutable">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L15419">property <b>immutable</b></a>

Immutable, if set to true, ensures that data stored in the Secret cannot be updated (only
object metadata can be modified). If not set to true, the field can be modified at any
time. Defaulted to nil. This is an alpha field enabled by ImmutableEphemeralVolumes feature
gate.

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="SecretProjection" data-link-title="SecretProjection">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L15542">
        interface <strong>SecretProjection</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>interface</span> <span class='nx'>SecretProjection</span></code></pre>

Adapts a secret into a projected volume.

The contents of the target Secret's Data field will be presented in a projected volume as
files using the keys in the Data field as the file names. Note that this is identical to a
secret volume source without the default mode.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SecretProjection-items">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L15551">property <b>items</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>items?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='#KeyToPath'>KeyToPath</a>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

If unspecified, each key-value pair in the Data field of the referenced Secret will be
projected into the volume as a file whose name is the key and content is the value. If
specified, the listed keys will be projected into the specified paths, and unlisted keys
will not be present. If a key is specified which is not present in the Secret, the volume
setup will error unless it is marked optional. Paths must be relative and may not contain
the '..' path or start with '..'.

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="SecretVolumeSource" data-link-title="SecretVolumeSource">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L15592">
        interface <strong>SecretVolumeSource</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>interface</span> <span class='nx'>SecretVolumeSource</span></code></pre>

Adapts a Secret into a volume.

The contents of the target Secret's Data field will be presented in a volume as files using
the keys in the Data field as the file names. Secret volumes support ownership management and
SELinux relabeling.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SecretVolumeSource-defaultMode">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L15599">property <b>defaultMode</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>defaultMode?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Optional: mode bits to use on created files by default. Must be a value between 0 and 0777.
Defaults to 0644. Directories within the path are not affected by this setting. This might
be in conflict with other options that affect the file mode, like fsGroup, and the result
can be other mode bits set.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SecretVolumeSource-items">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L15609">property <b>items</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>items?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='#KeyToPath'>KeyToPath</a>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

If unspecified, each key-value pair in the Data field of the referenced Secret will be
projected into the volume as a file whose name is the key and content is the value. If
specified, the listed keys will be projected into the specified paths, and unlisted keys
will not be present. If a key is specified which is not present in the Secret, the volume
setup will error unless it is marked optional. Paths must be relative and may not contain
the '..' path or start with '..'.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SecretVolumeSource-optional">

Specify whether the Secret or its keys must be defined

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="SecurityContext" data-link-title="SecurityContext">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L15630">
        interface <strong>SecurityContext</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>interface</span> <span class='nx'>SecurityContext</span></code></pre>

SecurityContext holds security configuration that will be applied to a container. Some fields
are present in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext.  When both are set, the values in
SecurityContext take precedence.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SecurityContext-allowPrivilegeEscalation">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L15637">property <b>allowPrivilegeEscalation</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>allowPrivilegeEscalation?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

AllowPrivilegeEscalation controls whether a process can gain more privileges than its
parent process. This bool directly controls if the no_new_privs flag will be set on the
container process. AllowPrivilegeEscalation is true always when the container is: 1) run as
Privileged 2) has CAP_SYS_ADMIN

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SecurityContext-capabilities">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L15643">property <b>capabilities</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>capabilities?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='#Capabilities'>Capabilities</a>&gt;;</code></pre>

The capabilities to add/drop when running containers. Defaults to the default set of
capabilities granted by the container runtime.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SecurityContext-privileged">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L15649">property <b>privileged</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>privileged?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Run container in privileged mode. Processes in privileged containers are essentially
equivalent to root on the host. Defaults to false.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SecurityContext-procMount">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L15656">property <b>procMount</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>procMount?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

procMount denotes the type of proc mount to use for the containers. The default is
DefaultProcMount which uses the container runtime defaults for readonly paths and masked
paths. This requires the ProcMountType feature flag to be enabled.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SecurityContext-readOnlyRootFilesystem">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L15661">property <b>readOnlyRootFilesystem</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>readOnlyRootFilesystem?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Whether this container has a read-only root filesystem. Default is false.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SecurityContext-runAsGroup">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L15668">property <b>runAsGroup</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>runAsGroup?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The GID to run the entrypoint of the container process. Uses runtime default if unset. May
also be set in PodSecurityContext.  If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext,
the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SecurityContext-runAsNonRoot">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L15677">property <b>runAsNonRoot</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>runAsNonRoot?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Indicates that the container must run as a non-root user. If true, the Kubelet will
validate the image at runtime to ensure that it does not run as UID 0 (root) and fail to
start the container if it does. If unset or false, no such validation will be performed.
May also be set in PodSecurityContext.  If set in both SecurityContext and
PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SecurityContext-runAsUser">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L15685">property <b>runAsUser</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>runAsUser?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The UID to run the entrypoint of the container process. Defaults to user specified in image
metadata if unspecified. May also be set in PodSecurityContext.  If set in both
SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes
precedence.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SecurityContext-seLinuxOptions">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L15693">property <b>seLinuxOptions</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>seLinuxOptions?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='#SELinuxOptions'>SELinuxOptions</a>&gt;;</code></pre>

The SELinux context to be applied to the container. If unspecified, the container runtime
will allocate a random SELinux context for each container.  May also be set in
PodSecurityContext.  If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value
specified in SecurityContext takes precedence.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SecurityContext-windowsOptions">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L15700">property <b>windowsOptions</b></a>

The Windows specific settings applied to all containers. If unspecified, the options from
the PodSecurityContext will be used. If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext,
the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence.

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="ServiceAccountTokenProjection" data-link-title="ServiceAccountTokenProjection">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L15843">
        interface <strong>ServiceAccountTokenProjection</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>interface</span> <span class='nx'>ServiceAccountTokenProjection</span></code></pre>

ServiceAccountTokenProjection represents a projected service account token volume. This
projection can be used to insert a service account token into the pods runtime filesystem for
use against APIs (Kubernetes API Server or otherwise).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ServiceAccountTokenProjection-audience">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L15854">property <b>audience</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>audience?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Audience is the intended audience of the token. A recipient of a token must identify itself
with an identifier specified in the audience of the token, and otherwise should reject the
token. The audience defaults to the identifier of the apiserver.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ServiceAccountTokenProjection-expirationSeconds">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L15863">property <b>expirationSeconds</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>expirationSeconds?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

ExpirationSeconds is the requested duration of validity of the service account token. As
the token approaches expiration, the kubelet volume plugin will proactively rotate the
service account token. The kubelet will start trying to rotate the token if the token is
older than 80 percent of its time to live or if the token is older than 24 hours.Defaults
to 1 hour and must be at least 10 minutes.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ServiceAccountTokenProjection-path">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-kubernetes/blob/6c3852761e92f2749859a0dc727be0115f534415/sdk/nodejs/types/input.ts#L15847">property <b>path</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>path: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Path is the path relative to the mount point of the file to project the token into.
